We investigated the relationship between intergenerational educational mobility and attitudes towards social justice aiming to respond the following main question: Does the experience of educational mobility predict attitudes towards principles of social justice?

Mobility

ESS

Immigration

Europe



In this paper, we show that upward educational mobility can moderate antipathy towards immigration, but this is more applicable in country-contexts where parental education is less relevant.

title: EqualStrength
text:
Updates




Two panels proposed by the EqualStrength team were accepted for the 2024 IMISCOE conference to be held in Lisbon in July 2024.




About

EqualStrength is a Horizon Europe project funded by the European Union. This research project investigates cumulative and structural forms of discrimination, outgroup prejudice and hate crimes against ethnic, racial and religious minorities.
Since 2023, I am a member of the EqualStrength team working directly with Mathew Creighton, who is the Principal Investigator of the project.
For more information, please visit the project’s website:





 Back to top

title: European Social Survey
text:
The European Social Survey investigates social attitudes across several European countries since 2002. I participated in the administration of the 9th round in Ireland together with Philip O’Connell, Mathew Creighton, and Micheal Collins.
For more information, visit the Irish website of the ESS:  European Social Survey

The editor Walter Bartl will present the book in an event hosted by The Institute for Advanced Studies in the Humanities in March 25th. The event will take place at the IASH, in Edinburgh, and will be also stramed online. You can register for free here.

title: Safe Learning
text:
In partnership with the UCD School of Education, Concern Worldwide conducted a five-year research study to provide evidence on strategies to improve learning and reduce School Related Gender Based Violence (SRGBV) in Sierra Leone.
The Safe Learning Study involved a randomised control trial of tiered interventions known as the ‘The Safe Learning Model’ in 100 communities.
I worked in the administration of the fieldwork and data analysis together with Dympna Devine, Seaneen Sloan, Ciaran Sugrue, Jennifer Symonds, Elena Samonova, Aimee Smith, and Ryan Gibbons.
For more information, visit the project’s website:  Safe Learning Study



 Back to top

title: World Values Survey
text:
Updates




Sofia Vizcarra Castillo had her grant application approved to conduct research on “Values and attitudes about climate change and energy transition in South America”. The Brazilian Science and Technology Ministry will fund her research from 2024 until 2027.




About

The World Values Survey is the largest academic social survey project in activity, conducted in about 100 countries since 1981. I have been involved in the administration of the Survey in Brazil since it’s 5th Wave in 2006.
Currently, Henrique Castro, Sofia Vizcarra and I are planning the fieldwork of the 8th wave.
For more information, visit the project’s website:
World Values Survey




 Back to top

title: University Climate Challenge
text:
Updates




Our colleague Orla Kelly will present the first results of our project at the Eastern Sociological Society 2024 Conference in Washington, DC.




About
The project is based on a collaboration between the School of Education and the School of Social policy, Social Work and Social Justice. The UCD College of Social Sciences and Law provided our research team with funding to investigate students’ understandings, attitudes and actions related to climate change.

title: About
text:
I am a Latin American sociologist interested in diverse topics such as education, research methods, and discrimination. My primary ‘language’ is social sciences, but I am fluent in those languages spoken by statisticians, data scientists and educationalists, as I had the privilege to work among ‘natives’ from these fields for many years.
My work stems from this ‘interethnic friction’ experienced in academia (UnB, UO, UCD, UofT), government (Inep) and international organisations (UNESCO, Unicef). You can find more information on my résumé below, or download it here.



 Back to top
